item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup lentils
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 carrots, diced
  • 2 celery stalks, diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon thyme
  • 1 bay leaf
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 pounds potatoes, peeled and cubed
  • 1/2 cup milk
  • 4 tablespoons butter

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large pot, combine lentils, vegetable broth, onion, carrots, celery, garlic, thyme, bay leaf, salt, and pepper.
  2. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 30-40 minutes until lentils are tender.
  3. Meanwhile, in a separate pot, boil the potatoes until tender, about 15-20 minutes.
  4. Drain the potatoes and mash with milk and butter until creamy.
  5. Serve the lentil stew in bowls topped with a scoop of creamy mashed potatoes.

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 20 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 15 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup shredded cooked chicken
  • 1 cup shredded cheese
  • 1/2 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
  • 1/2 cup corn
  • 1/4 cup diced red bell pepper
  • 1/4 cup diced green onions
  • 1 teaspoon taco seasoning
  • 1 package eggroll wrappers
  • Oil for frying

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, cheese, black beans, corn, red bell pepper, green onions, and taco seasoning.
  2. Lay an eggroll wrapper on a clean surface with a corner facing you.
  3. Place 2 tablespoons of the filling in the center of the wrapper.
  4. Fold the bottom corner over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll tightly.
  5. Seal the top corner with a little water.
  6. Heat oil in a deep skillet over medium heat.
  7. Fry the eggrolls in batches until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
  8. Remove and drain on paper towels.

item.content:encoded:

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 12

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup all-purpose flour

  • 1 teaspoon peppermint extract

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and line a cupcake pan with liners.

  9. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a bowl, mix crushed ginger snap cookies with melted butter until well combined.

  4. Add the pumpkin puree, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon to the cream cheese mixture and mix until well blended.
  5. Spread the pumpkin mixture over the crust evenly.
  6. In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form, then spread it over the pumpkin layer.
  7. Sprinkle additional cinnamon on top for garnish.
  8. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
